words.definition: bring something into existence
words.example: He created a thirty-acre lake.

words.definition: a small piece of shaped metal with incisions cut to fit the wards of a particular lock, which is inserted into a lock and turned to open or close it
words.example: There were two keys to the cupboard.

words.definition: the physical structure, including the bones, flesh, and organs, of a person or an animal
words.example: It's important to keep your body in good condition.

words.definition: having lived or existed for only a short time
words.example: A young girl came up to me and asked for money.

words.definition: of great significance or value
words.example: Important habitats for wildlife.

words.definition: an area of open land, especially one planted with crops or pasture
words.example: The farmer worked in the field from dawn till dusk.

words.definition: a small number of
words.example: Only a few guests remained after the party.

words.definition: the direction toward the point of the horizon where the sun rises at the equinoxes
words.example: The sun rises in the east.

words.definition: present, appearing, or found everywhere.
words.example: Smartphones are ubiquitous these days, with almost everyone using one.

words.definition: Used to specify a particular thing or person that has already been mentioned or is easily identified.
words.example: The sun rises in the east and sets in the west.

words.definition: Expressing the relationship between a part and a whole.
words.example: The pages of the book turned yellow over time.

words.definition: Used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences, that are to be taken jointly.
words.example: She bought apples and oranges from the market.

words.definition: Expressing motion in the direction of (a particular location).
words.example: Walking to the store is a pleasure on sunny days.

words.definition: Expressing the situation of something that is or appears to be enclosed or surrounded by something else.
words.example: She was in the garden when the phone rang.

words.definition: Third person singular present of be.
words.example: The sky is clear tonight.

words.definition: A greater or additional amount or degree of.
words.example: I need more time to finish the work.

words.definition: Used to refer to the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
words.example: Are you going to the store?

words.definition: A large town.
words.example: New York is a bustling city.

words.definition: A course or principle of action adopted or proposed by an organization or individual.
words.example: The company's privacy policy.

words.definition: An arithmetical value, expressed by a word, symbol, or figure, representing a particular quantity and used in counting and making calculations.
words.example: The number of participants was high.

words.definition: The exclusive legal right, given to an originator or an assignee to print, publish, perform, film, or record literary, artistic, or musical material, and to authorize others to do the same.
words.example: The book is protected by copyright.

words.definition: Able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal.
words.example: The dress is available in several sizes.

words.definition: Cause to feel happy and satisfied.
words.example: It pleases me to hear you're doing well.

words.definition: In a good or satisfactory way.
words.example: The project went well.

words.definition: Relating to or involving people in general, rather than being limited to a particular group of people.
words.example: Public opinion has turned against him.

words.definition: The recording, reproducing, or broadcasting of moving visual images.
words.example: We watched a video of the concert.

words.definition: That which is morally correct, just, or honorable.
words.example: They are fighting for their rights.

words.definition: Moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location).
words.example: He walked through the door.

words.definition: a number of people or things that are located, gathered, or classed together
words.example: She presented the idea to the group.

words.definition: perform an action, the precise nature of which is often unspecified
words.example: What does this tool do?

words.definition: a large number of
words.example: Many people agreed with her.

words.definition: a person who uses or operates something
words.example: The user should press return.

words.definition: the process of dealing with or controlling things or people
words.example: Good management is key to the success of any business.

words.definition: a piece or segment of something such as an object, activity, or period of time, which combined with other pieces makes up the whole
words.example: She played a part in the school play.

words.definition: to be aware of through observation, inquiry, or information
words.example: I know the answer to your question.

words.definition: activities engaged in for diversion or amusement
words.example: The children played games at the party.

words.definition: used to indicate possibility
words.example: I could go to the store if you need me to.

words.definition: joined together politically, for a common purpose, or by common feelings
words.example: The team stood united in their decision.

words.definition: an establishment providing accommodation, meals, and other services for travelers and tourists
words.example: We booked a hotel for our vacation.

words.definition: actually existing as a thing or occurring in fact; not imitation or artificial; genuine
words.example: The documentary tells the story of real people affected by the war.

words.definition: an individual article or unit, especially one that is part of a list, collection, or set
words.example: Each item on the list must be checked off.

words.definition: of an extent, amount, or intensity considerably above average
words.example: She achieved great success in her career.

words.definition: existing, occurring, or carried on between nations
words.example: She works for an international organization that promotes environmental awareness.

words.definition: to go from one place to another, typically over a distance of some length
words.example: She loves to travel and has visited over 20 countries.

words.definition: remarks expressing an opinion or reaction
words.example: The article received many positive comments from readers.

words.definition: the middle point or part of something
words.example: The town center was decorated for the holidays.

words.definition: produced in a particular way or place; past and past participle of make
words.example: The film was made in Hollywood.

words.definition: an American multinational e-commerce company that facilitates consumer-to-consumer and business-to-consumer sales through its website
words.example: I sold my old camera on eBay.

words.definition: the process of developing or being developed
words.example: The city's development included new parks.

words.definition: an account given of a particular matter, especially in the form of an official document
words.example: She filed a report on the project's status.

words.definition: a retail establishment selling items to the public
words.example: She picked up some groceries at the local store.

words.definition: The action or skill of reading written or printed matter silently or aloud
words.example: Her favorite pastime is reading novels.

words.definition: A continent in the northern hemisphere, separated from Asia by the Ural Mountains
words.example: Europe is known for its rich cultural heritage.

words.definition: A thing given willingly to someone without payment; a present
words.example: During the holidays, they exchanged gifts.

words.definition: Single; separate
words.example: Each individual has unique talents.

words.definition: With the addition of
words.example: Four plus four equals eight.

words.definition: self-moving or self-controlling
words.example: The auto industry is evolving rapidly with the advent of electric vehicles.

words.definition: to place something over or upon, as for protection, concealment, or warmth
words.example: Please cover the food to keep it warm.

words.definition: one part in every hundred
words.example: The company has seen a ten percent increase in sales this quarter.

words.definition: into or in one gathering, company, mass, place, or body
words.example: Let's get together for dinner this weekend.

words.definition: to prepare (text) for publication by checking and improving its accuracy, clarity, etc.
words.example: The manuscript was edited carefully before submission.

words.definition: under normal conditions
words.example: She usually arrives at work at around 9 AM.

words.definition: Constituting number three in a sequence; 3rd
words.example: She finished the race in third place.

words.definition: The solid mineral material forming part of the surface of the earth and other similar planets
words.example: The mountain trail was covered with large rocks.

words.definition: Subjects of conversation or discussion
words.example: The meeting covered a wide range of topics.

words.definition: a piece of paper or card that gives the holder a certain right, especially to enter a place, travel by public transport, or participate in an event
words.example: She bought tickets for the concert next month.

words.definition: an object, fact, or situation that is not exactly known or stated
words.example: The one thing I can't understand is why she left.

words.definition: the middle point or part of something
words.example: The vase was placed in the centre of the table.

words.definition: the act of providing the technology and services needed for internet sites and data to be viewed on the internet
words.example: The company is hosting the website on their servers.

words.definition: relating to the central government, and not to the government of a region, of some countries such as the US
words.example: The federal authorities are investigating the case.

words.definition: a set of explicit or understood regulations or principles governing conduct within a particular activity or sphere
words.example: The rules of the game are simple to follow.

words.definition: marked down as letters or words on a surface
words.example: She had written a letter to her friend.

words.definition: a piece of written, printed, or electronic matter that provides information or evidence or that serves as an official record
words.example: Please sign the document where indicated.

words.definition: formal requests to an authority for something
words.example: He submitted applications to several universities.

words.definition: A stock or supply of money, materials, staff, and other assets that can be drawn on by a person or organization in order to function effectively
words.example: The library is an excellent resource for research.

words.definition: A unit of linear measure equal to 5,280 feet (approximately 1.609 kilometers)
words.example: The next town is ten miles away.

words.definition: Copy (data) from one computer system to another, typically over the Internet
words.example: She downloads music from the online store.

words.definition: Happening or done before the usual or expected time
words.example: We decided to leave early to avoid traffic.

words.definition: A definite or clear expression of something in speech or writing
words.example: She made an official statement to the press.

words.definition: Make (something) more modern or up to date
words.example: The software has been updated to include the latest features.

words.definition: a chart or series of pages showing the days, weeks, and months of a particular year
words.example: She marked the date on her calendar.

words.definition: an area of a country or city, especially one regarded as a distinct unit because of a particular characteristic
words.example: The shopping district is always busy on weekends.

words.definition: a thing constituting a piece of evidence about the past, especially an account kept in writing or some other permanent form
words.example: She went through the archives to find the old records.

words.definition: a manner of doing something
words.example: The author's style is quite distinctive.

words.definition: the side or part of an object that presents itself to view or that is normally seen or used first
words.example: The front of the building was decorated with banners.

words.definition: the surroundings or conditions in which a person, animal, or plant lives or operates
words.example: Protecting the environment is a top priority for many organizations.

words.definition: a formal meeting for discussion
words.example: The international conference will be held in Geneva.

words.definition: a multinational technology company that develops, manufactures, licenses, supports, and sells computer software, consumer electronics, personal computers, and related services
words.example: Microsoft is one of the world's leading software companies.

words.definition: to manage or guide by advice, helpful information, instruction, etc.
words.example: He directed the students to the assembly hall.

words.definition: to set down in writing or the like, as for the purpose of preserving evidence
words.example: The meeting was recorded for those who could not attend.

words.definition: an opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle that is fitted with glass
words.example: She opened the window to let in fresh air.

words.definition: A number expressing the central or typical value in a set of data
words.example: The average of the three numbers is 15.

words.definition: an area, especially part of a country or the world having definable characteristics
words.example: The region is known for its natural beauty.

words.definition: a piece of land surrounded by water
words.example: They traveled to a tropical island for vacation.

words.definition: a country in Western Europe
words.example: France is famous for its wine and cuisine.

words.definition: The part of the earth's surface that is not covered by water
words.example: They plan to build a house on that piece of land.

words.definition: A structured set of data held in a computer, especially one that is accessible in various ways
words.example: Customer information is stored in a secure database.

words.definition: The process of making plans for something
words.example: The team is involved in the planning of the project.

words.definition: Relating to an authority or public body and its duties, actions, and responsibilities
words.example: She holds an official position in the government.

words.definition: Third person present tense of say; to utter words so as to convey information, an opinion, a feeling or intention, or an instruction
words.example: He says he will be there at eight.

words.definition: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time as regards heat, dryness, sunshine, wind, rain, etc.
words.example: The weather today is sunny with a slight chance of rain.

words.definition: A length or portion of time
words.example: He lived in Paris for a period of six years.

words.definition: the branch of physics that deals with the emission, behavior, and effects of electrons
words.example: He has a keen interest in electronics and gadgetry.

words.definition: expressing a doubt or choice between alternatives
words.example: He seemed undecided whether to go or stay.

words.definition: An action or system by which a result is brought about; a method
words.example: Education is a means to an end.

words.definition: Means of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation
words.example: We are exploring different solutions to the challenge.

words.definition: Supplied with mechanical or electrical energy
words.example: The vehicle is powered by a hybrid engine.

words.definition: done, produced, or occurring every day or every weekday
words.example: She reads the daily newspaper to catch up on current events.

words.definition: a person who is in charge of an activity, department, or organization
words.example: The director of the company decided to implement new policies.

words.definition: Restricted in size, amount, or extent
words.example: We have a limited amount of time to finish this project.

words.definition: Make a prominent exhibition of (something) in a place where it can be easily seen
words.example: The museum displays artifacts from ancient times.

words.definition: The machines, wiring, and other physical components of a computer or other electronic system.
words.example: Upgrading the hardware can significantly improve a computer's performance.

words.definition: Combustion or burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and typically give out bright light, heat, and smoke.
words.example: The campers gathered around the fire to keep warm.

words.definition: The standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.
words.example: HTML tags are used to create and structure online content.
